text: Plasmodium gallinaceum is a species of the genus Plasmodium (subgenus Haemamoeba) that causes malaria in poultry. == Description == This species was described by Alexandre Joseph Emile Brumpt (1877–1951) a French professor of parasitology during a trip to Ceylon (now Sri Lanka). == References == == Further reading == Category:Poultry diseases gallinaceum Category:Veterinary protozoology Category:Parasites of birds
title: Plasmodium gallinaceum
